biotools.summary:
Self-grouping convolutional neural networks.

Although group convolutions are increasingly used on deep convolutional neural networks to improve the computation efficiency and to reduce the number of parameters, most existing methods construct their group convolution architectures by predefinedly partitioning the filters of each convolutional layer into multiple regular filter groups with equally spatial group size and data-independence, which is disadvantageous to fully exploit their potential abilities.

bioschemas.name: SG-CNN
bioschemas.summary:
